bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 1 (Thursday, January 3, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BIGGS:H.R. 81.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8 of the United States Constitution[Page H213]

item.title: Tax Free Health Insurance Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text: This bill allows an individual taxpayer a deduction from gross income for insurance premiums paid for the health care coverage of the taxpayer and the taxpayer's spouse and dependents. The bill makes the deduction available whether or not the taxpayer itemizes other deductions.

bill.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow an above-the-line deduction for health insurance premiums.

item.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow an above-the-line deduction for health insurance premiums.
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow an above-the-line deduction for health insurance premiums.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
